summary: This is an internal email from a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) staff member forwarding a reporter's inquiry to colleagues. It reveals that the New York Times was contacting MCC staff about Jeffrey Epstein's death and prison conditions, and that MCC management was actively trying to prevent staff from speaking to the media.

persons.name: Christina Goldbaum
persons.context: A New York Times reporter who emailed MCC staff seeking information for a story about the prison and what happened to Jeffrey Epstein. She offered to speak on background.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the New York Times' story. The reporter is investigating what happened to him at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

connections.description: Goldbaum, as a reporter, is investigating the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death and conditions at the prison where he died.

events.title: NY Times Reporter Contacts MCC Staff
events.description: Christina Goldbaum of the New York Times emails MCC staff seeking information for a story about the prison and Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: MCC Warden Holds Staff Recall
events.description: The Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center holds a recall meeting with staff to express concerns about sharing information with the media, stating it is prohibited.

keyFacts: The New York Times was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's death and conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in August 2019.
MCC management was aware that at least two staff members had been contacted by the New York Times via their personal email addresses.
MCC leadership issued a directive that only approved staff were allowed to speak to the media and held a meeting to reiterate that sharing information was prohibited.
The document suggests the New York Times may have obtained staff email addresses through social media outlets.
